headline.seo: N.C.A.A. Women’s Softball: Hofstra Carries Banner for the Underdogs

docs.snippet: With 16 teams left in the 2012 N.C.A.A. women’s softball tournament, Hofstra is the only private and only Northeast university left....
docs.abstract: Hofstra is the only private university left in the 2012 NCAA softball tournament, and is the last remaining team from the Northeast; key to Hofstra's success has been pitcher Olivia Galati, who leads the NCAA in earned run average and shutouts.
docs.lead_paragraph: With 16 teams left in the 2012 N.C.A.A. women’s softball tournament, Hofstra is the only private and only Northeast university left.

headline.print_headline: At a Wildfire Base Camp, Logistics and Pop-Tarts
headline.seo: Wildfire Base Camp, Spring Valley, Ariz.
headline.main: At a Wildfire Base Camp, Logistics and Pop-Tarts

docs.snippet: In Arizona, a makeshift camp at a high school sustains 1,160 firefighters spread across three outposts in the mountains and 498 other workers....
docs.abstract: Spring Valley Journal; makeshift camp at Mayer High School in Spring Valley, Ariz, sustains 1,160 firefighters who are waging a protracted wildfire battle in the area; exceptionally low humidity and record-high temperatures in the region signal a potentially devastating fire season.
docs.lead_paragraph: In Arizona, a makeshift camp at a high school sustains 1,160 firefighters spread across three outposts in the mountains and 498 other workers.

headline.print_headline: New Jersey Mayor Hacked Opponents’ Web Site, U.S. Charges
headline.seo: West New York, N.J., Mayor Accused of Hacking Opponents’ Web Site
headline.main: New Jersey Mayor Hacked Opponents’ Web Site, U.S. Charges

docs.snippet: Dr. Felix Roque of West New York, N.J., and his son face federal charges....
docs.abstract: Federal prosecutors charge Mayor Felix Roque of West New York, NJ, and son Joseph with gaining unauthorized access to computers and disabling the Web site of election campaign being run by political opponents of the mayor; father and son both face up to 11 years in prison and $600,000 in fines.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Felix Roque of West New York, N.J., and his son face federal charges.

headline.print_headline: In the Shadow of Ashe Stadium, Working Hard to Return
headline.seo: Melanie Oudin Working to Regain 2009 U.S. Open Form
headline.main: In the Shadow of Ashe Stadium, Working Hard to Return

docs.snippet: Melanie Oudin, who reached the quarterfinals of the United States Open in 2009 at age 17, is training at the United States Tennis Association’s center in Queens to help regain her winning form....
docs.abstract: Melanie Oudin, whose performance dropped off dramatically after reaching the quarterfinals of the 2009 United States Open at age 17, seeks to regain her winning form.
docs.lead_paragraph: Melanie Oudin, who reached the quarterfinals of the United States Open in 2009 at age 17, is training at the United States Tennis Association’s center in Queens to help regain her winning form.

headline.print_headline: Supply Ship Passes Test Before Docking
headline.seo: Supply Ship Passes Test in Space Before Docking
headline.main: Supply Ship Passes Test Before Docking

docs.snippet: The unstaffed SpaceX Dragon capsule performed a practice lap near the International Space Station and checked out its communication and navigation systems....
docs.abstract: SpaceX Dragon, the world's first private supply ship, passes critical test as it prepares to dock with the International Space Station.
docs.lead_paragraph: The unstaffed SpaceX Dragon capsule performed a practice lap near the International Space Station and checked out its communication and navigation systems.

headline.print_headline: Iran Is Seeking Lebanon Stake As Syria Totters
headline.seo: With Syria in Turmoil, Iran Seeks Deeper Partner in Lebanon
headline.main: Iran Is Seeking Lebanon Stake as Syria Totters

docs.snippet: Iran’s eagerness to shower money on Lebanon is the latest indication of just how worried Tehran is at the prospect that Syria’s leader could fall....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Iran’s eagerness to shower money on Lebanon when its own finances are being squeezed by sanctions is the latest indication of just how worried Tehran is at the prospect that Syria’s leader, Bashar al-Assad, could fall; Iran relies on Syria as a bridge to the Arab world and as a crucial partner in confronting Israel; challenge for Iran's leaders is that many Lebanese see the gestures not as a show of good will, but as a stealth cultural and military colonization.
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran’s eagerness to shower money on Lebanon is the latest indication of just how worried Tehran is at the prospect that Syria’s leader could fall.

headline.print_headline: Soldier Guilty in Plot to Bomb A Restaurant Near Ft. Hood
headline.seo: Texas: AWOL Soldier Guilty in Fort Hood Bomb Plot
headline.main: Soldier Guilty in Plot to Bomb a Restaurant Near Ft. Hood

docs.snippet: The Army private, Pfc. Naser Jason Abdo, said the bombing of a restaurant filled with other soldiers was his religious mission....

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Pfc Naser Jason Abdo, a Muslim, is convicted in a plot to blow up a restaurant full of troops from Fort Hod as part of a religious mission to get 'justice' for the people of Iraq and Afghanistan; is found guilty of six charges, including attempting to use a weapon of mass destruction.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Army private, Pfc. Naser Jason Abdo, said the bombing of a restaurant filled with other soldiers was his religious mission.

headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Quits Her Job as Officials Review Handling of a Rape Case in Crown Heights
headline.seo: Lauren Hersh, Brooklyn Prosecutor, Resigns as Rape Case Is Reviewed
headline.main: Prosecutor Quits Her Job as Rape Case Is Reviewed

docs.snippet: A Brooklyn assistant district attorney brought a rape case before a grand jury although the accuser had recanted some of her claims....
docs.abstract: Prosecutor Lauren Hersh, head of the sex trafficking unit at the Brooklyn district attorney’s office, resigns as the agency begins reviewing controversial Crown Heights rape case that she oversaw in 2010; grand jury indicted four men on charges of prolonged sexual assault against a 13-year-old girl, but it was eventually revealed that, prior to the indictments, the accuser had already recanted certain allegations involving two of the men in an interview with detectives.

byline.original: By COLIN MOYNIHAN and ALAN FEUER

docs.lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn assistant district attorney brought a rape case before a grand jury although the accuser had recanted some of her claims.

headline.print_headline: Suspension For Trainer Of Top Colt
headline.main: 45-Day Suspension for Trainer of Top Colt

docs.snippet: Doug O’Neill, the trainer of Triple Crown hopeful I’ll Have Another, was suspended 45 days on Thursday for exceeding the allowable limit for total carbon dioxide in one of his horses....
docs.abstract: Doug O'Neill, trainer of Triple Crown hopeful I'll Have Another, is suspended 45 days for exceeding the allowable limit for total carbon dioxide in one of his horses, indicating the use of performance-enhancing drugs; his punishment is set to begin on July 1, allowing him to saddle his colt in the Belmont Stakes on June 9.
docs.lead_paragraph: Doug O’Neill, the trainer of Triple Crown hopeful I’ll Have Another, was suspended 45 days on Thursday for exceeding the allowable limit for total carbon dioxide in one of his horses.
